original_text:
Admission Date :
1989-03-20
Discharge Date :
2015-12-31
Date of Birth :
1931-12-09
Sex :
M
Service :
This is an addendum to the discharge summary that was dictated earlier this morning .
Continuing throughout his course he had multiple infectious disease issues .
He developed zoster for which he received a course of acyclovir .
His cultures came back as noted with Klebsiella ultimately in his chest wound , MRSA in his sputum .
He had multiple sources of yeast .
Currently his only yeast source is urine .
Negative blood cultures at this point .
Also in the course of the month that he was in the ICU he had a left chest tube placed for fluid and then a right chest tube placed ultimately for fluid .
He received O.T. and P.T. consults .
He developed another round of acute renal failure with ATN and casts in his urine .
On 11-18 a DNR order was put into place .
He also started treatment for gallstones with cholestasis on the medication ursodiol .
He received a course of cefepime also .
He continued to have multiple dressing changes after his split thickness skin grafts , which he does to this day .
In early November he started dialysis after a PermCath was placed .
His Dobbhoff tube was removed .
He was able to use a Passy-Muir valve intermittently for his trach .
On 12-23 he went back to the operating room for open jejunostomy tube dehiscence site .
His J tube is now functioning .
This was repaired and stay sutures are in place .
This was done on 11-23 .
On 11-24 he received a permanent DDD pacemaker with a lead that was externally placed on his chest wall due to his healing and infected chest wound .
From the point of discharge today on 12-31 his most recent labs are as follows .
White count 13.9 , hematocrit 35.9 , platelet count 81,000 .
Sodium 139 , K 4.8 , chloride 109 , CO2 31 , BUN 33 , creatinine 2.2 , blood sugar 164 .
Albumin 2.5 .
Vancomycin level was 21 .
To go by systems , currently he is neurologically alert and follows commands .
He occasionally gets agitated .
From a cardiac point of view , he is in sinus rhythm today .
He does have his pacing lead with his external pacemaker DDD available to him and is being followed by the EP service and Dr. Janet Gutkin for further outpatient treatment of this
in the future .
From a respiratory point of view , he is on CPAP and pressure support at 5 and 5 at 40% .
He does use the Passy-Muir valve intermittently for his trach .
He is on a trach collar this week during the day only and rested on the ventilator at
night .
Abdominally , he does have his midabdominal incision with good approximated margins and stay sutures in place .
From a GI point of view , he is receiving Promote tube feeds through his jejunostomy tube .
His chest incision is granulating in well .
He currently receives saline washes and Adaptic dressing changes twice a day .
From a CMED CCU point of view , he gets straight cathed every other day .
He has a left subclavian PermCath access for his dialysis which takes place on Monday , Wednesday and Friday .
Hematology .
He is HITT negative .
He has received no transfusions in the past week or so .
His hematocrit has been stable in the mid-30s .
He has a PICC line in place for his antibiotics which are as follows .
The PICC line was placed on 12-29 .
His antibiotics currently are vancomycin , ceftazidime , fluconazole and caspofungin .
I will give doses and administration information in his list of discharge medications .
In addition , his albumin today is 2.5 .
He is being covered by regular insulin sliding scale .
Exam today shows he is neurologically alert .
Heart was regular rate and rhythm .
He had coarse respiratory sounds .
Abdomen was soft .
His graft is granulating in .
DISCHARGE MEDICATIONS :
1. Docusate sodium 100 mg p.o. b.i.d.
2. Ursodiol 300 mg p.o. b.i.d.
3. Ascorbic acid 500 mg p.o. q.d.
4. Zinc sulfate 220 mg p.o. q.d.
5. Lansoprazole oral solution 30 mg per gastric tube q.d.
6. Caspofungin acetate 50 mg IV q.d. , day 23 of treatment and patient should remain on it indefinitely .
7. Nephrocaps one cap p.o. q.d.
If on dialysis, please take after dialysis treatment .
8. Metoclopramide 5 mg p.o. b.i.d. , take 30 minutes before meals .
9. Fluconazole 200 mg p.o. q.h.d.
Patient should remain on this medication .
10. Magnesium sulfate 2 gm in 100 ml of D5W IV as needed for repletion p.r.n.
11. Miconazole powder 2% one application t.p. t.i.d. p.r.n.
12. Acetaminophen 325 mg to 650 mg p.o. q.four to six hours p.r.n.
13. Albuterol one to two puffs inhaled q. six hours p.r.n.
14. Bisacodyl 10 mg per rectum h.s. as needed p.r.n.
15. Hydralazine hydrochloride 10 mg IV q. six hours p.r.n. systolic blood pressure greater than 140 .
16. Vancomycin 1 gm IV as needed for vancomycin level less than 15 .
This is day 23 of treatment for an approximate six week course .
17. Ceftazidime 1 gm IV q.h.d. after dialysis .
18. Alteplase for catheter clearance 2 mg IV once times one dose for indwelling PermCath .
DISCHARGE DIAGNOSES :
1. Status post aortic valve replacement and coronary artery bypass grafting times four .
2. Status post sternal debridement .
3. Status post skin graft to chest incision .
4. Status post open jejunostomy tube placement , open left subclavian PermCath placement .
5. Status post DDD pacer placement with external generator .
6. Status post abdominal repair of wound dehiscence of jejunostomy site .
7. Status post percutaneous tracheostomy .
8. Status post acute renal failure .
9. Status post myocardial infarction .
10. Hypertension .
11. Hypercholesterolemia .
12. Asthma .
13. Peptic ulcer disease status post gastrectomy 30 years ago .
14. Colon cancer status post colectomy with XRT four years ago .
15. Peripheral vascular disease with history of bilateral lower extremity claudication .
16. COPD with asbestosis on chest CT scan .
The patient is discharged on Thursday , 12-31 , to a rehabilitation facility , on postoperative day 93 , in stable condition , from the cardiac surgery recovery unit .
Perry G. Ozuna , M.D.
83-390
Dictated By : Keith E. Shafer , M.D.
MEDQUIST36
D : 2015-12-31 11:12
T : 2015-12-31 11:19
JOB #:
04648
Signed electronically by : DR. Kelsey MOORMAN on : FRI 2016-01-08 9:29 PM
( End of Report )
